intro: Jacquemontia violacea var. densiflora, commonly known as the denseflowered jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glory relatives. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, violet to purple flowers. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
